alert.note: Alert for Central Lea County; Eddy County Plains; Northern Lea County; Southern Lea County (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Midland-Odessa (Western Texas and Southeastern New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 24 at 8:15PM MDT by NWS Midland-Odessa
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT SOUTHEASTERN EDDY...LEA...WESTERN ANDREWS AND WESTERN GAINES COUNTIES THROUGH 1015 PM CDT/915 PM MDT/... At 914 PM CDT/814 PM MDT/, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 12 miles south of Caprock to 8 miles southwest of Lovington to 16 miles northeast of Red Bluff Reservoir. Movement was east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Hobbs, Lovington, Eunice, Jal, Tatum, Monument, Humble City, Eunice Airport, Jal Airport, Nadine, McDonald, Gladiola, Tatum Airport, Knowles, Halfway, Lea County Regional Airport, Industrial Airpark, Oil Center, and Higginbotham. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Central Lea County; Eddy County Plains; Northern Lea County; Southern Lea County
